pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.BalloonStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.BalloonStyle.BalloonStyle(text: Optional[str] = None, text_color: Optional[int] = None, bg_color: Optional[int] = None, display_mode: Optional[DisplayMode] = None)¶

Bases: SubStyle

A KML ‘BalloonStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#balloonstyle. Specifies how the description balloon of Placemark objects is drawn.

Parameters:

  • text (Optional[str]) – The (optional) text to be displayed in the balloon.

  • text_color (Optional[int]) – The (optional) color of the text to be displayed, in 32-bit ABGR format.

  • bg_color (Optional[int]) – The (optional) background color of the balloon, in 32-bit ABGR format.

  • display_mode (Optional[DisplayMode]) – The (optional) DisplayMode of the balloon.

property bg_color: Optional[int]¶

The background color of the balloon, in 32-bit ABGR format.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property display_mode: Optional[DisplayMode]¶

The balloon DisplayMode.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘BalloonStyle’

property text: Optional[str]¶

The text displayed in the balloon. Note that HTML markup, e.g. tables, is permissible.

property text_color: Optional[int]¶

The color of the text in the balloon, in 32-bit ABGR format.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.ColorStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.ColorStyle.ColorStyle(color: Optional[int] = None, color_mode: Optional[ColorMode] = None)¶

Bases: SubStyle, ABC

A KML ‘ColorStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#colorstyle. The ColorStyle is the abstract base class for a subset of the specific sub-styles that are optionally included in Style objects, and that act to apply a color, typically (but not exclusively) to Feature objects.

Parameters:

  • color (Optional[int]) – The (optional) color, in ABGR format, that will be applied by GEP if the color_mode is NORMAL.

  • color_mode (Optional[ColorMode]) – The (optional) ColorMode that will be used by GEP to determine the displayed color.

Variables:

  • color (Optional[int]) – The (optional) color, in ABGR format, that will be applied by GEP if the color_mode is NORMAL.

  • color_mode (Optional[ColorMode]) – The (optional) ColorMode that will be used by GEP to determine the displayed color.

property color: Optional[int]¶

Color, in 32-bit ABGR format (yes, the order is correct).

property color_mode: Optional[ColorMode]¶

The ColorMode that will be used by GEP to determine the displayed color.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Container module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Container.ContainedFeature(container, feature)¶

Bases: tuple

Named tuple that describes a container:contained relationship between a Container instance and a Feature instance.

container: Container¶

Alias for field number 0

feature: Feature¶

Alias for field number 1

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Container.Container(name: Optional[str] = None, visibility: Optional[bool] = None, is_open: Optional[bool] = None, update_limit: int = 100, style_url: Optional[str] = None, styles: Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]] = None, features: Optional[Iterable[Feature]] = None)¶

Bases: list[Feature], Feature, ABC

A KML ‘Container’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#container. Note that while Containers are explicitly abstract, Container is the base class for KML Folder and Document that have an “existence” in GEP, i.e. that are (potentially) user-editable because they appear in the GEP user List View, and that may ‘contain’ other Feature objects, including other concrete Container objects.

Parameters:

  • name (Optional[str]) – The (optional) name for this Container that will be displayed in GEP.

  • visibility (Optional[bool]) – The (optional) initial visibility for this Container in GEP.

  • is_open (Optional[bool]) – Optional boolean flag to indicate whether the Container will be displayed as ‘open’ in the GEP user List View.

  • update_limit (Optional[int]) – Only applies to the root of a Feature tree. The (approximate) maximum number of contained Feature instances that will be synchronized from this Container during any one synchronization update.

  • style_url (Optional[str]) – An (optional) style URL, generally a reference to a global StyleSelector in a parent of this Container.

  • styles (Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]]) – An (optional) Iterable of StyleSelector objects that will be local to this Container.

  • features (Optional[Iterable[Feature]]) – An (optional) Iterable of Feature objects to be enclosed by this Container.

append(item: Feature)¶

Append a Feature to this Container.

Parameters:

item (Feature) – The Feature to be appended.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property children: Iterator[ObjectChild]¶

Overridden from pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Object.Object.children to yield the children of a Container, i.e. one or more StyleSelector instances, and their children.

construct_kml(with_features: bool = False) → Element¶

Overridden from construct_kml() to allow for the creation of contained or enclosed Feature instances, including other Container instances.

property containers: Iterator[ContainedFeature]¶

A generator to retrieve references to any Container objects that are enclosed by this Container object, and the tree that is rooted at it.

Returns:

A generator of ContainedFeature named tuples that describe each enclosed Container as a (container, feature)

property features: Iterator[ContainedFeature]¶

A generator to retrieve references to the Feature objects that are enclosed by this Container object, and the tree that is rooted at it. Note that Container objects are not yielded by this generator, despite being specializations of Feature; use the containers property to retrieve them.

Returns:

A generator of ContainedFeature named tuples that describes each enclosed Feature as a (container, feature)

property flush: Iterator[Feature]¶

A generator to retrieve instances of Feature objects that have been deleted from this Container but for which those deletions have not yet been synchronized with GEP. As the generator retrieves a deleted Feature, it also completes the deletion process.

Returns:

A generator of Feature objects.

force_features_idle()¶

Force the entire tree of enclosed Feature (and Container) instances to be forced to the IDLE state. Typically called as a result of the target Container being deleted from GEP.

force_idle(cascade: bool = False)¶

Overridden from force_idle() to enable the entire tree of enclosed Feature (and Container) instances, and child Object instances, that is rooted in this Container to be forced to the IDLE state.

property is_open: Optional[bool]¶

True if the Container will be initially displayed in an ‘open’ state in the GEP user List View, else False if it will be initially displayed in a ‘closed’ state. None implies the default of False.

remove(_Container__value: Feature) → None¶

Remove a Feature from this Container. Of course, the Feature must be enclosed in this Container to be able to be removed.

Parameters:

__value (Feature) – The Feature to be removed.

select(value: bool, cascade: bool = False)¶

Overrides select() to implement select/deselect cascade to enclosed Feature objects, and to ensure that if a Container is deleted from GEP, its’ enclosed Feature objects are forced IDLE to maintain synchronization.

property update_limit: int¶

The (approximate) maximum number of KML objects that will be synchronized by any single synchronization update that is rooted in this Container.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Document module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Document.Document(name: Optional[str] = None, visibility: Optional[bool] = None, is_open: Optional[bool] = None, style_url: Optional[str] = None, styles: Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]] = None, features: Optional[Iterable[Feature]] = None)¶

Bases: Container

A KML ‘Document’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#document. Document inherits from Container and hence Document objects are containers for Feature objects, including other Container instances.

Parameters:

  • name (Optional[str]) – The (optional) name for this Document that will be displayed in GEP.

  • visibility (Optional[bool]) – The (optional) initial visibility for this Document in GEP.

  • is_open (Optional[bool]) – Optional flag to indicate whether the Document will be displayed as ‘open’ in the GEP user List View.

  • style_url (Optional[str]) – An (optional) style URL, generally a reference to a global StyleSelector in a parent of this Document.

  • styles (Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]]) – An (optional) iterable of StyleSelector instances that will be local to this Document.

  • features (Optional[Iterable[Feature]]) – An (optional) iterable of Feature instances to be enclosed by this Document.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘Document’

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Feature module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Feature.Feature(name: Optional[str] = None, description: Optional[str] = None, visibility: Optional[bool] = None, container: Optional[Feature] = None, style_url: Optional[str] = None, styles: Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]] = None)¶

Bases: Object, ABC

A KML ‘Feature’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#feature. Note that while Features are explicitly abstract in the KML specification, Feature is the base class for KML Object instances that have an “existence” in GEP, i.e. that are (potentially) user-editable because they appear in the GEP user List View.

Parameters:

  • name (Optional[str]) – The (optional) name for this Feature that will be displayed in GEP.

  • description (Optional[str]) – The (optional) description for this Feature that will be displayed in GEP as a text balloon if the Feature is clicked.

  • visibility (Optional[bool]) – The (optional) initial visibility for this Feature in GEP.

  • container (Optional[Feature]) – The (optional) Feature (generally, a Container) that encloses this Feature.

  • style_url (Optional[str]) – An (optional) style URL, typically a reference to a global StyleSelector in a Container that encloses this Feature.

  • styles (Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]]) – An iterable of StyleSelector objects that are local to this Feature.

property container: Optional[Container]¶

The Container that immediately encloses this Feature in an ownership tree.

Warning:

The container property cannot be altered if the Feature is visible in GEP. Doing so would break GEP synchronization. Failure to observe this constraint will cause a ValueError to be raised.

property description: Optional[str]¶

The text description for this Feature, that will be displayed in a balloon in GEP if the Feature is clicked.

Note:

HTML and (some) JavaScript are permissible (in GEP > 5.0) for the description property. Refer to the KML specification at https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference for details.

property name: Optional[str]¶

The text that will be displayed as the name of the Feature in GEP.

select(value: bool, cascade: bool = False)¶

Overrides select() to implement upwards cascade of selection. That is, if a Feature enclosed in the object tree depending from an unselected parent Feature is selected, the reverse tree’s parents must also be selected in order for GEP synchronization to work correctly.

property styles: Iterator[StyleSelector]¶

A generator to retrieve references to any Style or StyleMap objects that are children of this Feature.

Returns:

A generator of StyleSelector objects.

property visibility: Optional[bool]¶

True if the Feature will (initially) be checked (visible) in GEP, False otherwise.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Folder module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Folder.Folder(name: Optional[str] = None, visibility: Optional[bool] = None, is_open: Optional[bool] = None, style_url: Optional[str] = None, styles: Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]] = None, features: Optional[Iterable[Feature]] = None)¶

Bases: Container

A KML ‘Folder’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#folder. Folder inherits from Container and hence Folder objects are containers for Feature objects, including other Container instances.

Parameters:

  • name (Optional[str]) – The (optional) name for this Folder that will be displayed in GEP.

  • visibility (Optional[bool]) – The (optional) initial visibility for this Folder in GEP.

  • is_open (Optional[bool]) – Optional flag to indicate whether the Folder will be displayed as ‘open’ in the GEP user List View.

  • style_url (Optional[str]) – An (optional) style URL, generally a reference to a global StyleSelector in a parent of this Folder.

  • styles (Optional[Iterable[StyleSelector]]) – An (optional) iterable of StyleSelector instances that will be local to this Folder.

  • features (Optional[Iterable[Feature]]) – An (optional) iterable of Feature instances to be enclosed by this Folder.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘Folder’

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Geometry module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Geometry.Geometry¶

Bases: Object, ABC

A KML ‘Geometry’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#geometry. The Geometry class is the abstract base class for KML Object instances that have an existence as geospatial objects in GEP and that are children of Placemark instances.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Icon module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Icon.GxParams(x, y, w, h)¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Icon.Icon(href: Optional[str] = None, refresh_mode: Optional[RefreshMode] = None, refresh_interval: Optional[float] = None, gx_params: Optional[GxParams] = None)¶

Bases: Link

A KML ‘Icon’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#icon. Icon instances are used to specify an image file that will be displayed in a GEP overlay. Note that only time-based refresh of Icon instances is currently supported by pyLiveKML.

Parameters:

  • href (Optional[str]) – An (optional) href for the file that is referenced by the Icon.

  • refresh_mode (Optional[RefreshMode]) – The (optional) RefreshMode that will be used for file loading.

  • refresh_interval (Optional[float]) – The (optional) refresh interval, in seconds, that will be used for file loading.

  • gx_params (Optional[GxParams]) – Optional GxParams instance that defines how GEP will treat the icon image.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property gx_params: Optional[GxParams]¶

A GxParams named tuple that describes how the icon is treated by GEP.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘Icon’

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.IconStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.IconStyle.IconStyle(icon: str, scale: float = 1.0, heading: float = 0.0, color: Optional[int] = None, color_mode: Optional[ColorMode] = None)¶

Bases: ColorStyle

A KML ‘IconStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#iconstyle. Specifies various properties that define how a Icon is drawn. Applies to Point geometries.

Parameters:

  • icon (str) – A URI for an image or icon file.

  • scale (float) – The (optional) relative scale of the icon.

  • heading (float) – The (optional) heading, in degrees, that the icon will be rotated to point towards.

  • color (Optional[int]) – The (optional) color of the icon, as a 32-bit ABGR value.

  • color_mode (Optional[ColorMode]) – The (optional) ColorMode used to color the icon; either ‘NORMAL’ or ‘RANDOM’.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property heading: Optional[float]¶

Heading (in degrees) that the icon will be displayed pointing towards in GEP.

property hotspot: Optional[Vec2]¶

Relative position in the icon that is anchored to the associated Point

property icon: Optional[str]¶

URI for the image that will be displayed in GEP as the icon.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘IconStyle’

property scale: Optional[float]¶

Relative scale at which the icon will be displayed in GEP.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.LineString module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.LineString.LineString(coordinates: Iterable[GeoCoordinates], altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode] = None, extrude: Optional[bool] = None, tessellate: Optional[bool] = None, gx_altitude_offset: Optional[float] = None, gx_draw_order: Optional[int] = None)¶

Bases: Geometry

A LineString geometry, as per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#linestring. LineString objects define an open sequence of points, or GeoCoordinates such as might make up a track.

Parameters:

  • coordinates (Iterable[GeoCoordinates]) – An iterable of GeoCoordinates objects, or points, that define the LineString. There should be at least two points.

  • altitude_mode (Optional[AltitudeMode]) – The (optional) AltitudeMode that will be applied by GEP to all the points that make up the LineString.

  • extrude (Optional[bool]) – An (optional) flag to indicate whether the points that make up the LineString should be shown in GEP connected to the ground with vertical lines.

  • tessellate (Optional[bool]) – An (optional) flag to indicate whether the LineString should follow the terrain.

  • gx_altitude_offset (Optional[float]) – An (optional) altitude offset (in metres) to be applied to every point that makes up the LineString.

  • gx_draw_order (Optional[int]) – An (optional) indication of the order in which overlapping LineString objects should be drawn.

property altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode]¶

An AltitudeMode instance that defines how GEP displays the GeoCoordinates objects that make up the LineString and treats their altitudes.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property coordinates: Iterator[GeoCoordinates]¶

A generator to retrieve the GeoCoordinates objects that define this LineString object.

Returns:

A generator of GeoCoordinates objects.

property extrude: Optional[bool]¶

True if a vertical line (using the current LineStyle) connects each of the LineString objects’ points to the ground in GEP, False otherwise. None implies False.

property gx_altitude_offset: Optional[float]¶

An offset, in metres, that is applied to the altitude of all the points (GeoCoordinates) that define this LineString instance.

property gx_draw_order: Optional[int]¶

An integer that specifies the draw order when multiple LineString objects are drawn over the top of one another in GEP. Lower values are drawn first.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘LineString’

property tessellate: Optional[bool]¶

True if the boundary line of the LineString follows the terrain in GEP, otherwise False.

Note:

The altitude_mode property must be set to CLAMP_TO_GROUND to enable tessellation.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.LineStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.LineStyle.LineStyle(width: Optional[float] = None, color: Optional[int] = None)¶

Bases: ColorStyle

A KML ‘LineStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#linestyle. Specifies various properties of a Geometry, typically either a LineString or LinearRing, including the inner and outer boundaries of Polygon objects.

Parameters:

  • width (Optional[float]) – The (optional) width of the line, in pixels.

  • color (Optional[int]) – The (optional) color of the line, as a 32-bit ABGR value.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property gx_label_visibility: Optional[bool]¶

Selector to display a text label on a LineString. True if the label is to be displayed, False if it is not. None implies False.

property gx_outer_color: Optional[int]¶

Color of the portion of the line defined by the gx_outer_width property. Note that both gx_outer_color and gx_outer_width apply only to LineString objects.

property gx_outer_width: Optional[float]¶

Width of an outer border around the line. Note that both gx_outer_color and gx_outer_width apply only to LineString objects.

property gx_physical_width: Optional[float]¶

The physical width of the line, in metres.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘LineStyle’

property width: Optional[float]¶

The width of the line, in pixels.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.LinearRing module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.LinearRing.LinearRing(coordinates: Iterable[GeoCoordinates], altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode] = None, extrude: Optional[bool] = None, tessellate: Optional[bool] = None, gx_altitude_offset: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: Geometry

A LinearRing geometry, as per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#linearring. LinearRing objects describe a geospatial boundary that is defined by a closed sequence of points, where points map to GeoCoordinates instances.

Parameters:

  • coordinates (Iterable[GeoCoordinates]) – An iterable of GeoCoordinates objects, or points, that define the boundary of the LinearRing. There should be at least three points.

  • altitude_mode (Optional[AltitudeMode]) – The (optional) AltitudeMode that will be applied by GEP to all the points that make up the boundary of the LinearRing.

  • extrude (Optional[bool]) – An (optional) flag to indicate whether the points that make up the boundary of the LinearRing should be shown in GEP connected to the ground with vertical lines.

  • tessellate (Optional[bool]) – An (optional) flag to indicate whether the LinearRing should follow the terrain.

  • gx_altitude_offset (Optional[float]) – An (optional) altitude offset, in metres, to be applied to every point that makes up the boundary of the LinearRing.

property altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode]¶

An AltitudeMode instance that defines how GEP displays the GeoCoordinates objects that make up the boundary of the LinearRing and treats their altitudes.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property coordinates: Iterator[GeoCoordinates]¶

A generator to retrieve the GeoCoordinates objects that define the boundary of the LinearRing object.

Returns:

A generator of GeoCoordinates objects.

property extrude: Optional[bool]¶

True if a vertical line (using the current LineStyle) connects each of the LinearRing objects’ points to the ground in GEP, False otherwise. None implies False.

property gx_altitude_offset: Optional[float]¶

An offset, in metres, that is applied to the altitude of all the points (GeoCoordinates) that define the boundary of this LinearRing instance.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘LinearRing’

property tessellate: Optional[bool]¶

True if the boundary line of the LinearRing follows the terrain in GEP, otherwise False.

Note:

The altitude_mode property must be set to CLAMP_TO_GROUND to enable tessellation.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Link module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Link.Link(href: Optional[str] = None, refresh_mode: Optional[RefreshMode] = None, refresh_interval: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: Object

A KML ‘Link’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#link. Link objects are used to specify a KML file to be fetched with a NetworkLink; or an image file to be used in a GEP overlay, using the Icon class that inherits from Link. The KML specification also uses Link objects to specify the location of Models, but Models are not currently implemented in pyLiveKML.

Note:

Only time-based refresh is currently supported by pyLiveKML.

Parameters:

  • href (Optional[str]) – An (optional) href for the file that is referenced by the Link.

  • refresh_mode (Optional[RefreshMode]) – The (optional) refresh mode that will be used for file loading.

  • refresh_interval (Optional[float]) – The (optional) refresh interval, in seconds, that will be used for file loading.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property href: Optional[str]¶

A URI that specifies the location of the resource that is linked to.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘Link’

property refresh_interval: Optional[float]¶

The refresh interval, in seconds, that will be used if the refresh_mode property is set to ON_INTERVAL.

property refresh_mode: Optional[RefreshMode]¶

The RefreshMode that controls when the file specified by the ‘href’ property is retrieved.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.ListStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.ListStyle.ListStyle(list_item_type: Optional[ListItemType] = None, bg_color: Optional[int] = None, item_icon_state: Optional[ItemIconMode] = None, item_icon_href: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: SubStyle

A KML ‘ListStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#liststyle. Specifies how a Feature is displayed in GEP’s user List View.

Parameters:

  • list_item_type (Optional[ListItemType]) – The (optional) behaviour model for the list item.

  • bg_color (Optional[int]) – The (optional) background color for the list item.

  • item_icon_state (Optional[ItemIconMode]) – The (optional) icon state that will be displayed for the list item.

  • item_icon_href (Optional[str]) – The (optional) URI for the image will be displayed for the list item.

property bg_color: Optional[int]¶

The background color of the list item, as a 32-bit ABGR color.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property item_icon_href: Optional[str]¶

The URI for the image that will be displayed in the GEP user List View for the item.

property item_icon_state: Optional[ItemIconMode]¶

The icon state that will be displayed in the GEP user List View for the item.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘ListStyle’

property list_item_type: Optional[ListItemType]¶

The behaviour model for the list item.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.NetworkLink module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.NetworkLink.NetworkLink(name: Optional[str] = None, href: Optional[str] = None, refresh_mode: Optional[RefreshMode] = None, refresh_interval: Optional[float] = None, is_open: Optional[bool] = None)¶

Bases: Feature

A KML ‘NetworkLink’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#networklink. NetworkLink objects are typically used to direct GEP to periodically retrieve a file from a specified href.

Parameters:

  • name (Optional[str]) – The (optional) text that will be displayed in the GEP user List View as the name of the NetworkLink.

  • href (Optional[str]) – An (optional) href for the file that will be loaded by the NetworkLink.

  • refresh_mode (Optional[RefreshMode]) – The (optional) refresh mode that will be used for file loading.

  • refresh_interval (Optional[float]) – The (optional) refresh interval, in seconds, that will be used for file loading.

  • is_open (Optional[bool]) – Optional flag to indicate whether the NetworkLink will be displayed as ‘open’ in the GEP user List View.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property children: Iterator[ObjectChild]¶

A generator to retrieve the children of this Object as ObjectChild instances.

Returns:

A generator of ObjectChild named tuples that describes each child Object as a (parent, child)

property fly_to_view: Optional[bool]¶

True if this NetworkLink instructs GEP to fly to its view location when loaded, else False if it does not. None implies the default of False.

property is_open: Optional[bool]¶

True if the NetworkLink will be initially displayed in an ‘open’ state in the GEP user List View, else False if it will be initially displayed in a ‘closed’ state. None implies the default of False.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘NetworkLink’

property link: Link¶

The child Link object that identifies how and from where this NetworkLink will load its dependent file.

property refresh_visibility: Optional[bool]¶

True if the GEP user is not permitted to control the visibility of the NetworkLink or its children, else False if the GEP user has full control over that visibility. None implies the default of False.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Object module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Object.Object¶

Bases: ABC

A KML ‘Object’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#object. Note that the Object class is explicitly abstract, and is the base class from which most other KML elements (anything with an id property) derive.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children: bool = True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

change_kml(update: Element)¶

Construct a complete <Change> element tree as a child of an <Update> tag.

Parameters:

update (etree.Element) – The etree.Element of the <Update> tag that will be appended to.

property children: Iterator[ObjectChild]¶

A generator to retrieve the children of this Object as ObjectChild instances.

Returns:

A generator of ObjectChild named tuples that describes each child Object as a (parent, child)

construct_kml() → Element¶

Constructs this Object’s KML representation.

Returns:

The KML representation of the object as an etree.Element.

create_kml(parent: Object, update: Element) → Element¶

Construct a complete <Create> element tree as a child of an <Update> tag.

Parameters:

  • parent (Object) – The immediate parent Object of this Object. The parent must be specified for GEP synchronization.

  • update (etree.Element) – The etree.Element of the <Update> tag that will be appended to.

delete_kml(update: Element)¶

Construct a complete <Delete> element tree as a child of an <Update> tag.

Parameters:

update (etree.Element) – The etree.Element of the <Update> tag that will be appended to.

field_changed()¶

Flag that a field or property of this Object has changed, and re-synchronization with GEP may be required.

force_idle()¶

Force this Object and all of its children to the IDLE state. This is typically done after the object has been deselected, which will cause it to be deleted from GEP at the next synchronization update. When the Object is deleted by GEP, all of its children, and any Feature objects that it encloses, will also be automatically deleted. There is no need to emit <Delete> tags for these deletions, and in fact doing so will likely cause GEP to have conniptions.

property id: uuid4¶

The unique identifier of this Object.

abstract property kml_type: str¶

Abstract property that specifies the name of the XML tag that forms the root of the KML representation of this Object.

select(value: bool, cascade: bool = False)¶

Select or deselect this Object for display in GEP.

Parameters:

  • value (bool) – True for selection, False for deselection

  • cascade (bool) – True if the selection is to be cascaded to all child Objects.

property selected: bool¶

True if this Object has been created and is not scheduled for deletion, otherwise False.

property state: State¶

The current GEP synchronization state of this Object.

update_generated()¶

Modify the state of the Object to reflect that a synchronization update has been emitted.

update_kml(parent: Object, update: Element)¶

Retrieve a complete child <Create>, <Change> or <Delete> KML tag as a child of an <Update> tag. The type of child tag retrieved is dependent on the current state of this Object.

Parameters:

  • parent (Object) – The immediate parent Object of this Object. The parent is required only for <Create> tags.

  • update (etree.Element) – The etree.Element of the <Update> tag that will be appended to.

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Object.ObjectChild(parent, child)¶

Bases: tuple

Named tuple that describes a parent:child relationship between two Object instances.

child: Object¶

Alias for field number 1

parent: Object¶

Alias for field number 0

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Placemark module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Placemark.Placemark(geometry: Geometry, name: Optional[str] = None, visibility: Optional[bool] = None, inline_style: Optional[StyleSelector] = None, style_url: Optional[str] = None)¶

Bases: Feature

A KML ‘Placemark’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#placemark. Placemark objects are containers for a geospatial element to be displayed in GEP.

Parameters:

  • geometry (Geometry) – A concrete Geometry instance that will be displayed in GEP for this Placemark.

  • name (Optional[str]) – The (optional) name that will be displayed in GEP for this Placemark.

  • visibility (Optional[bool]) – The (optional) initial visibility for this Placemark in GEP.

  • inline_style (Optional[StyleSelector]) – An (optional) StyleSelector that will be applied to this Placemark (only).

  • style_url (Optional[str]) – An (optional) style URL, generally a reference to a global StyleSelector in a parent of this Placemark.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property children: Iterator[ObjectChild]¶

Overridden from pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Object.Object.children to yield the children of a Placemark, i.e. a Geometry instance, zero or more StyleSelector instances, and any dependent SubStyle instances.

property geometry: Geometry¶

The geospatial object, or Geometry, that will be displayed in GEP as this Placemark.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘Placemark’

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Point module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Point.Point(coordinates: GeoCoordinates, extrude: Optional[bool] = None, altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode] = None)¶

Bases: Geometry

A Point geometry, as per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#point. Point objects define a simple geographic location, described a longitude, latitude and optional altitude.

Parameters:

  • coordinates (GeoCoordinates) – A GeoCoordinates object that defines the longitude, latitude and optional altitude of the Point.

  • extrude (Optional[bool]) – An (optional) flag to indicate whether the Point should be shown in GEP connected to the ground with a vertical line.

  • altitude_mode (Optional[bool]) – The (optional) AltitudeMode that will be applied to the Point by GEP.

property altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode]¶

An AltitudeMode instance that defines how GEP displays the Point and treats its’ altitude.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property coordinates: GeoCoordinates¶

A GeoCoordinates object that defines the longitude, latitude and optional altitude of the Point.

property extrude: Optional[bool]¶

True if a vertical line (using the current LineStyle) connects the Point to the ground in GEP, False otherwise. None implies False.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘Point’

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.PolyStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.PolyStyle.PolyStyle(color: Optional[int] = None, color_mode: Optional[ColorMode] = None, fill: Optional[bool] = None, outline: Optional[bool] = None)¶

Bases: ColorStyle

A KML ‘PolyStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#polystyle. Specifies various properties that define how a Polygon is drawn.

Parameters:

  • color (Optional[int]) – The (optional) color, as a 32-bit ABGR value, that will be used to fill the polygon’s area in GEP.

  • color_mode (Optional[ColorMode]) – An (optional) ColorMode that determines how GEP chooses the polygon fill color.

  • fill (Optional[bool]) – Optional flag to indicate whether GEP should fill in the polygon with a color.

  • outline (Optional[bool]) – Optional flag to indicate whether GEP should draw the polygon’s outline.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property fill: bool¶

True if the affected Polygon is to be filled in using the color property. False if it is not. None implies True.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘PolyStyle’

property outline: bool¶

True if the outline of the Polygon is to be drawn using a separate LineStyle, specified in the StyleSelector that is the parent of this PolyStyle instance. False if it is not. None implies True.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Polygon module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Polygon.Polygon(outer_boundary: LinearRing, inner_boundaries: Optional[Iterable[LinearRing]] = None, altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode] = None, extrude: Optional[bool] = None, tessellate: Optional[bool] = None)¶

Bases: Geometry

A Polygon geometry, as per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#polygon. Polygon objects are made up of an outer boundary that is a LinearRing and zero or more inner boundaries, each of which is also a LinearRing.

Parameters:

  • outer_boundary (LinearRing) – A LinearRing that defines the outer extents of the Polygon.

  • inner_boundaries (Optional[Iterable[LinearRing]]) – An (optional) iterable of LinearRing objects that define any cutouts within the Polygon.

  • altitude_mode (Optional[AltitudeMode]) – The (optional) AltitudeMode that will be applied by GEP to all the points that make up the Polygon.

  • extrude (Optional[bool]) – An (optional) flag to indicate whether the points that make up the Polygon should be shown in GEP connected to the ground with vertical lines.

  • tessellate (Optional[bool]) – An (optional) flag to indicate whether the boundaries of the Polygon should follow the terrain.

property altitude_mode: Optional[AltitudeMode]¶

An AltitudeMode instance that defines how GEP displays the GeoCoordinates objects that make up the inner and outer boundaries of the Polygon and treats their altitudes.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property children: Iterator[ObjectChild]¶

Overridden from pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Object.Object.children to yield the children of a Polygon, i.e. one or more LinearRing instances, being the outer_boundary and zero or more inner_boundaries.

property extrude: Optional[bool]¶

True if a vertical line (using the current LineStyle) connects each of the outer_boundary and inner_boundaries objects’ points to the ground in GEP, False otherwise. None implies False.

property inner_boundaries: Iterator[LinearRing]¶

A generator to retrieve the LinearRing objects that define cutouts within the outer_boundary.

Returns:

A generator of LinearRing objects.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘Polygon’

property outer_boundary: LinearRing¶

The LinearRing that defines the outer extents of the Polygon.

property tessellate: Optional[bool]¶

True if the inner and outer boundary lines of the Polygon follows the terrain in GEP, otherwise False.

Note:

The altitude_mode property must be set to CLAMP_TO_GROUND to enable tessellation.

update_kml(parent: Object, update: Element)¶

Retrieve a complete child <Create>, <Change> or <Delete> KML tag as a child of an <Update> tag. The type of child tag retrieved is dependent on the current state of this Object.

Parameters:

  • parent (Object) – The immediate parent Object of this Object. The parent is required only for <Create> tags.

  • update (etree.Element) – The etree.Element of the <Update> tag that will be appended to.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.StyleMap module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.StyleMap.StyleMap(normal_style_url: Optional[str] = None, normal_style: Optional[Style] = None, highlight_style_url: Optional[str] = None, highlight_style: Optional[Style] = None)¶

Bases: StyleSelector

A KML ‘StyleMap’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#stylemap. Maps between two different Style objects for the NORMAL and HIGHLIGHT states of a Feature when it is displayed in GEP. The child Style objects may be referenced by URI, or in-line in the StyleMap.

Parameters:

  • normal_style_url (Optional[str]) – An (optional) URI reference for a Style to be employed in NORMAL display mode.

  • normal_style (Optional[Style]) – An (optional) inline Style to be employed in NORMAL display mode.

  • highlight_style_url (Optional[str]) – An (optional) URI reference for a Style to be employed in HIGHLIGHT display mode.

  • highlight_style (Optional[Style]) – An (optional) inline Style to be employed in HIGHLIGHT display mode.

Note:

It is both possible and reasonable to assign both a styleUrl and a Style to either or both of the NORMAL and HIGHLIGHT states. Per the rules discussed at https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#feature, an inline Style will override a URI-referenced Style.

build_kml(root: Element, with_children=True)¶

Generate the KML representation of the internal fields of this Object, and append it to the provided root etree.Element.

Parameters:

  • root (etree.Element) – The root XML element that will be appended to.

  • with_children (bool) – True if the children of this instance should be included in the build.

property children: Iterator[ObjectChild]¶

Overridden from pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.Object.Object.children to yield the children of a Style, i.e. up to two Style instances.

property highlight_style: Optional[Style]¶

An inline Style that will be employed when the target Feature is displayed in HIGHLIGHT mode.

property highlight_style_url: Optional[str]¶

A URI that references the Style that will be employed when the target Feature is displayed in HIGHLIGHT mode.

property kml_type: str¶

Overridden from kml_type to set the KML tag name to ‘StyleMap’

property normal_style: Optional[Style]¶

An inline Style that will be employed when the target Feature is displayed in NORMAL mode.

property normal_style_url: Optional[str]¶

A URI that references the Style that will be employed when the target Feature is displayed in NORMAL mode.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.StyleSelector module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.StyleSelector.StyleSelector¶

Bases: Object, ABC

A KML ‘StyleSelector’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference#styleselector. The StyleSelector class is the abstract base class for KML Object instances that represent display styles for Feature instances.

pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.SubStyle module¶

class pyLiveKML.KML.KMLObjects.SubStyle.SubStyle¶

Bases: Object, ABC

A KML ‘SubStyle’, per https://developers.google.com/kml/documentation/kmlreference. Note that there is no description of the SubStyle class in the Google KML documentation, although it is included in the inheritance tree at the top of the page. The SubStyle class is the abstract base class for the specific sub-styles that are optionally included as children Style objects.
